name: scattergun
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
US (also shotgun) a long gun that fires a large number of small metal bullets at one time, designed for shooting birds and animals : You could shoot a scattergun there, and not hit a soul. Because squirrels are small, a 12-bore scattergun isn't much use.

(also scattershot, uk/ˈskæt.ə.ʃɒt/ us/ˈskæt̬.ɚ.ʃɑːt/) involving doing something to a lot of things or people without any organized plan, rather than doing it to particular things or people: Don't have a scattergun approach - calling everyone you know to see if there is a job going - but work out what you want from different people. Were you singled out by the advisor to receive the email - rather than just being hit randomly by a scattergun one?
of several very different types: The targets for this novel are as scattergun as the hilarious prose. Such scattergun responses show only uncertainty, even among the experts.
